fields.name: studyId
fields.title: Study unique ID
fields.description: Semicolon-separated list of (internal) study identifiers (cross-referencing to study worksheet) where the event was recorded.

fields.name: biologicalMaterialId
fields.title: Biological material ID
fields.description: Code used to identify the biological material in the data file. Should be unique within the Investigation. Can correspond to experimental plant ID, seed lot ID, etcâ€¦ This material identification is different from a BiosampleID which corresponds to Observation Unit or Samples sections below.

fields.name: biologicalMaterialExtId
fields.title: Biological material external ID
fields.description: One to many identifiers for the biological material. Can include EBI Biosamples ID. URI are recommended when possible.

fields.name: organism
fields.title: Organism
fields.description: An identifier for the organism at the species level. Use of the NCBI taxon ID is recommended.

fields.name: genus
fields.title: Genus
fields.description: Genus name for the organism under study, according to standard scientific nomenclature.

fields.name: species
fields.title: Species
fields.description: Species name (formally: specific epithet) for the organism under study, according to standard scientific nomenclature.

fields.name: infraspecificName
fields.title: Infraspecific name
fields.description: Name of any subtaxa level, including variety, crossing name, etc. It can be used to store any additional taxonomic identifier. To be filled as key-value pair list format (the key is the name of the rank/category and the value is the value of  the rank/category). Ranks/categories can be among the following terms: subspecies, cultivar, variety, subvariety, convariety, group, subgroup, hybrid, line, form, subform. For MCPD compliance, the following abbreviations are allowed: "subsp." (subspecies); "convar." (convariety); "var." (variety); "f." (form); "Group" (cultivar group). MIAPPE adds "cv." (cultivar).
fields.example: subspecies:vinifera, cultivar:Pinot noir ; subsp.:aestivum, cv.:Weneda, Group:winter ; subsp. vinifera cv. Pinot Noir

fields.name: biologicalMaterialLatitude
fields.title: Biological material latitude
fields.description: Latitude of the studied biological material. [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

fields.name: biologicalMaterialLongitude
fields.title: Biological material longitude
fields.description: Longitude of the studied biological material. [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

fields.name: biologicalMaterialAltitude
fields.title: Biological material altitude
fields.description: Altitude of the studied biological material, provided in meters (m). [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

fields.name: biologicalMaterialCoordUncertainty
fields.title: Biological material coordinates uncertainty
fields.description: Circular uncertainty of the coordinates, preferably provided in meters (m). [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

fields.name: biologicalMaterialPreprocessing
fields.title: Biological material preprocessing
fields.description: Description of any process or treatment applied uniformly to the biological material, prior to the study itself. Can be provided as free text or as an accession number from a suitable controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: materialSourceId
fields.title: Material source ID (Holding institute/stock centre, accession)
fields.description: An identifier for the source of the biological material, in the form of a key-value pair comprising the name/identifier of the repository from which the material was sourced plus the accession number of the repository for that material. Where an accession number has not been assigned, but the material has been derived from the crossing of known accessions, the material can be defined as follows: "mother_accession X father_accession", or, if father is unknown, as "mother_accession X UNKNOWN". For in situ material, the region of provenance may be used when an accession is not available. The Material source is commonly called germplasm, accession, genotype and even variety for commercial varieties. For the latest, keep in mind that a variety is commonly ambiguously identified and polysemous

fields.name: materialSourceDoi
fields.title: Material source DOI
fields.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of the material source

fields.name: materialSourceAccNumber
fields.title: Material source accession number
fields.description: Unique identifier for accessions within a genebank. If material source is not from a genebank, use a laboratory ID. In the case of a commercial variety, use the variety code, or name if no code available.

fields.name: materialSourceAccName
fields.title: Material source accession name
fields.description: Can be: (i)genebank accession registered name or other designation given to the material, other than the donor's accession number or collecting number. (ii) Variety name.

fields.name: materialSourceInstCode
fields.title: Material source institute code
fields.description: FAO WIEWS code of the institute where the accession is maintained. The current set of institute codes is available from https://www.fao.org/wiews. If no institute code is available, create your own (Laboratory acronym or research institute acronym ...).

fields.name: materialSourceInstName
fields.title: Material source institute name
fields.description: Name of the material source institute.

fields.name: materialSourceOtherIds
fields.title: Material source other identifiers
fields.description: Any other identifiers known to exist in other collections for this material source. Use key:value pairs, separated by semicolons.

fields.name: materialSourceLatitude
fields.title: Material source latitude
fields.description: Latitude of the material source. [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

fields.name: materialSourceLongitude
fields.title: Material source longitude
fields.description: Longitude of the material source. [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

fields.name: materialSourceAltitude
fields.title: Material source altitude
fields.description: Altitude of the material source, provided in metres (m). [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

fields.name: materialSourceCoordUncertainty
fields.title: Material source coordinates uncertainty
fields.description: Circular uncertainty of the coordinates, provided in meters (m). [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

fields.name: materialSourceDesc
fields.title: Material source description
fields.description: Description of the material source
